Yes, the film was the weakest chain of the Dabanng series but it is not as bad as it is trashed on social media. Nowadays, people err their judgments due to the positive or negative hype, can't have their own personal liking and disliking. If something is in trends it must be spectacular, If something is not it must be crap, that is the scenario for Dabanng 3.

Dabanng 3 is a film, which works on the element of Masala genre, and Salman Khan, which is in its own brand, a cinema. His films don't work on the laws of filmmaking, he is the "BHAI" Afterall, a mammoth of personality and attitude and that's what he has presented in Dabanng 3 but the film was let down by its visual effects and down south action choreography if the action director emphasized on the dramatic and simple action, It would be a gem film.

The story has loopholes, It has all the flavors of a masala genre, but didn't well made, the villain looks weak, never developed throughout the film and Sudeep acted brilliantly If he had given more screen presence and some more cruel tricks, it will be an altogether different film. Everyone knows about Chulbul, so if the Bali Singh has more roots in the story, It would be fun to watch, battling one another.

Music was another weakest link of the film, Only Munna Badnaam Hua, has some moves and tunes the songs were pathetic, probably the worst Salman Khan films album. He has a definite taste, I am quite shocked what happened to him, with his music sense.

Dabanng 3 could be better, but it is watchable, a masala entertainer, the action and music irritate you but Sae Manjrekar, Sudeep, Sohail Khan, and Dhakad Chand Pandey makes you watch this film till the end.

review_title: Salmanathon that fails to make any impact
review_detailed_main:
Dabangg 3 - This installment has Salman Khan written all over it, practically. He is the producer, story (ahem) writer, screenplay writer, and of course, the hero. The result is a 150 minute film with him in every frame, more narcissistic than ever before. Actually "main thoda confujiya gaya hoon, ki yeh kis genre ki film hai - comedy, thriller, action, ....", but who cares, it has Salman Khan, the rest can take a walk. Actually, Dabangg 3 was meant to be a prequel to the original - the transformation of Dhaakad Singh Pandey to Chulbul Pandey and the inspiration behind it, Khushi (Saiee Manjrekar), his original love interest. Thereafter, it turns into a revenge saga of epic proportions.

But let's not go into the story as there isn't one. Dabangg 3 has so much of Salman Khan in it that even his die hard fans will pray for a break. Alas, there is no mercy here. There are numerous subplots that refuse to allow focus to the narrative and the film keeps meandering. On top of that, there isn't cohesion within the screenplay which makes it disjointed - a comic scene is quickly followed by an action sequence and then a romantic interlude featuring a song. It's downright disturbing and amateurish. Dabangg 3 is at best a polished 1970's potboiler that aims to drive home a few social messages.

Kichcha Sudeepa as Bali Singh, Chulbul's antagonist is the only one who delivers a credible and almost menacing performance. His output is well nuanced and he makes a good hand at acting. Saiee Manjrekar is passable, Sonakshi Sinha constantly pouts and is irritating. The interaction between Salman and Sonakshi has some senseless baby talk (meant to be sweet nothings), completely lacking chemistry. The music by Sajid Wajid is good, but there are too many songs that grate on the nerves. This time director Prabhudeva fails to deliver a taut thriller, but I personally believe that it must be because of Salman's creative dabbling.

3 STARS overall, maybe with a little less of Bhai it could have earned a better rating. Avoid, if you aren't a die hard Sallu fan.

The Dabangg franchise has never been one that made me think "WOW! This series is amazing". I enjoyed the first one as there was some competence visible and effort put into it. The second one lost all the strengths of its predecessor and barely had anything charming about it. However, what Salman Khan has done to the third installment is absolutely atrocious.

Dabangg 3 reunites us with Chulbul Pandey as we see him go up against Balli Singh, an enemy from the past that destroyed his first love.

This story isn't anything special. We've seen countless films in the past that have used this exact same storyline and now it's at point where it has become old and overused but since Salman Khan knows people will turn up to his film no matter what it's about, it was a smart move from him to write the most generic revenge story. Speaking about the writing, this screenplay is one of the worst of the year. Everything is so bland. So many of the jokes fall flat which make it excruciatingly difficult to sit through the film's 2 hour 30 minute runtime. I feel Khan should just stick to acting because writing is not his cup of tea.

From the trailer alone I could tell how bad this film was going to be but I had a bit of hope that at least the action would be entertaining to watch. Apart from the final battle, every other action scene had nothing exciting about it. On top of that the action WASN'T EVEN SHOT WELL. There were a few times where you couldn't tell what was happening due to the poor camerawork and direction. Prabhudeva, what went wrong?! Let's not forget the unbearable editing. There is so much slow motion used which make the scenes go on forever and visual effects that are completely unnecessary. The background score was obnoxious throughout and the overabundance of songs dragged the film further.

I feel the choice of having an origin story had a lot of potential. It would have been a great way to add further depth to Chulbul's character and help us learn more about the villain but sadly none of this is explored in much detail. Salman Khan does an earnest job as Chulbul Pandey even though, a couple of times, he was a bit too over the top. Sudeep also does a good job despite his severely underwritten role. He brings a good amount of intensity to his character but we learn nothing from his character. He's one of the most basic antagonists you could come up with. The female roles were also played well but had very little to do. They just served as plot points and nothing beyond that.

At this point this franchise should end. All the humour, charm and wit that was gained in the first one has been fully lost in Dabangg 3. This is one of the most boring films of the year and an absolute pain to finish. I wish Abhinav Kashyap would come back to help give this series the boost it needs.

#FinalVerdict

The pre-Christmas week has at last shown up. The best is always reserved for the last and it has been a custom to have at least one biggie unfurl in the Christmas week before the curtains fall on the on-going year. Salman Khan teams up with the Hit machine - director Prabhudheva -- yet again. In addition, several enviable names, on and off-screen, lend muscle to the enterprise. The canvas is gigantic as well. It can't get bigger than Dabangg 3, honestly.

Prabhudheva is synonymous with audience-friendly movies. Most critics may abhor his work, however, the paying public - the ones who matter ultimately - adores his film. His films may not offer ground-breaking stuff, nor do they get exemplary honours, yet he whips up a storm at the box-office each time he attempts a high-on-entertainment fare.

This is for fans and adversaries of Salman Khan... Fans, cheer, Salman is back furiously with Dabangg 3. This is his deadliest performance to date. Indeed, you read it right! Adversaries, sorry, you won't have the option to lash out at him or dispatch a horrendous tirade this time. Well, without mincing my words, I must avow that Dabangg 3 is aimed exclusively at the hoi polloi. It rides on Salman Khan's star power. In a film like Dabangg 3, in a role that appears to be an expansion of his character, you can't even consider any other actor portraying this role with flourish.

Recollect the successful potboilers of yore. Recall how the hero would diminish 10 goons to mash in a fraction of seconds. Recall how heroism won at last, regardless of how unfriendly the conditions were. Recall those films wherein rationale assumed a lower priority since the attention was on entertainment... You relive those moments as Dabangg 3 unfolds. It may/may not make sense to you, but screenplay writers - Salman Khan, Prabhudheva and Aloke Upadhyaya - ensure that you are entertained.

With Dabangg 3, one is well prepared about what's in store. The sole factor that director Prabhudheva needs to stress over is whether Dabangg 3 would meet the towering and monumental expectations. More so, because Salman Khan is contending with himself. Salman Khan has redefined superstardom with mass entertainers. He's box-office's favourite actor and seems invincible and insurmountable at the moment! Hardcore masala films are relished with glee by the audience and Dabangg 3 takes this genre one step ahead. Sure, it's an old wine packed in a brand new bottle but the result is sheer magic. Most importantly, Dabangg 3 has Salman Khan like never before. In fact, breathing fire and venom, Chulbul Pandey aka Robinhood Pandey taps Salman's star power like no film has. Dabangg 3 stands on three pillars - Salman Khan's star power, smashing stunts and super music.

In a nutshell, Dabangg 3 delivers what it promises: Entertainment in enormous doses. Prabhudheva's latest offering speaks the language that the masses comprehend. It's one formula that can never go out of fashion if handled smartly. Actually, Chulbul Pandey has come to represent the common man and that's yet another reason why you root for him, feel overjoyed and ecstatic when he triumphs in the finale. For anyone who needs to comprehend what is the on-screen meaning of Bollywood, Dabangg 3 is absolutely textbook fare.

Let's face it, Dabangg 3 has nothing ground-breaking to offer as far as the story (Salman Khan) is concerned. But what makes Dabangg 3 shine, and shine brightly, is Salman Khan's star power, which camouflages the aberrations wonderfully. The film is special for two more reasons: Anl Arasu's stunts and Sajid-Wajid's music. Talking of action scenes, Salman's introduction at the start and the fight-to-finish in the climax, when Salman's shirt tears apart and the rippling muscles and the bare-chest fight ensues, will send the masses in frenzy. To state that the action scenes are outstanding, especially the fight in the finale would be an understatement. Mark my words, the action scenes will lead to chaos at mass-dominated centres, especially at single screens. It won't be erroneous to state that the climax is worth the price of the ticket, samosa, sandwich, popcorn, nachos and cola put together.

Sajid-Wajid's music is of a mixed variety and gels wonderfully with the genre of the film. Munna Badnaam Hua track will send the viewers into raptures. The background score (Sandeep Shirodkar) is electrifying and in sync with the on-screen situations. Dialogue (Dilip Shukla and Aloke Upadhyaya) are excellent. The lines are written with equivalent flamboyance and will be greeted with claps and whistles. Mahesh Limaye's cinematography is top-notch and he makes every frame appear larger-than-life.

But Dabangg 3 is not without its share of flaws. The film stands on a thin storyline and the viewer can guess what's in store next. Besides, the film could've done without a song or two, thereby keeping its length in check (editor: Ritesh Soni). However, these are minor aberrations. For, the plusses easily outweigh and outnumber the minuses here.

The principal cast provides the much-needed sheen to Prabhudheva's vision. Salman Khan uses his fists, spews venom and threats, bullies the villain, flirts and romances, does the pelvic thrusts... in fact, he does everything that one expects from Chulbul Pandey. Honestly speaking, Dabangg 3 is a Salman Khan vehicle and the actor is the Big Boss here. You cannot imagine anyone else doing what he does. And every time he plays to the gallery, many in the audience (especially at single screens) are sure to fling the loose change on screen as a mark of appreciation for his on-screen antics. He defies logic and gets away with it! He is like a ferocious lion who roars with all his might. The show belongs to the actor, who scorches the screen every time he displays the manic anger. From a statutory warning against cigarette and gutka, mouthed by Khan, to his anti-dowry stance and a message on water conservation and a dig at demonetization at the very end, there is also ample messaging to be found in the movie.

Sonakshi Sinha's pairing with Salman looks wonderful. She is her usual chirpy and feisty self as Rajjo. She delivers the right expressions. The newcomer Saiee Manjrekar has an infectious charm and radiates confidence all through the enterprise. The character she portrays has tremendous mass appeal. Also, the desi girl image suits her impeccably. She is camera-friendly and confident to the T. Arbaaz Khan is okay. Dimple Kapadia is truly wonderful. Pramod Khanna (brother of late Vinod Khanna) is excellent. Kichcha Sudeep has a good screen presence. He is superb as the antagonist. He's venomous to the hilt! Yet another sterling act that doesn't miss a beat! He takes giant strides as an actor & gives the film the much-needed support.

On the whole, Dabangg 3 is the emblematic formula movie with distinct essentials that Indian masses yearn for. The film is for those who seek unabashed entertainment and relish masala films. Damn the indomitable critics, pseudo-intellectuals and connoisseurs of parallel cinema, this one's not for them. Dabangg 3 is for the aam junta. Entertainment guaranteed. Dabangg 3 is your ticket this festive season. Dhamaal entertainer!

review_title: Not among Khan's very worst...just close.
review_detailed_main:
I usually don't watch sequels without seeing the original film. However, when it is a bad movie and the original isn't so bad, I go right to the bad film in some cases. Why? Because the sequels have managed to make IMDB's ignoble Bottom 100 List...and I, for some odd reason, like to see these films. Fortunately, it's not all I like...there are many wonderful films I love. But ever since reading "The Fifty Worst Movies of All Time" (by Harry Medved), I find I occasionally like seeing godawful movies just for the laughs they unintentionally generate. Will "Dabangg 3" generated laughs...or just be a chore to finish?

Salman Khan stars in the series and I've seen him in quite a few other Indian films. I must admit he is not among my favorites...mostly because the films of his I've seen tend to be gangster and action ovies....which are not among my favorites...though I have loved a few of his movies, such as "Baabul" and "Baghban". Unfortunately, he's also made movies like this one as well as "Race 3" and "Tees Maar Khan"...which are among my least favorite Indian films.

Like in the other "Dabangg" films, Khan plays a cop...Inspector Pandey. He's a super-cop who is able to take on gangs all by himself...though the film definitely tends towards showing him doing this in a comedic and over-the-top manner...and almost cartoonish. It also uses a lot of so-called 'wire fu'...a technique popularized in Hong Kong martial arts films where folks fly through the air when fighting...because they're being pulled by wires (which are digitally removed...making the person seem to 'fly'). This COULD work...but does it? Well, judging by its overall score of 3.0, I'd say that would be no.

What's to like? Well, like many Indian films, there is the usual singing and dancing...and it's choreographed well and the songs aren't bad.

What's not to like? The biggest problem I noticed is Khan's character. At times, he is almost a caricature and if you don't like this strange and funny caricature, then you're in trouble as he's in every frame of the movie!! He also often stares into the camera...mugging quite a bit. Khan lovers will like this...most others will just feel it's a case of Khan overload or that this is some vanity project.

Overall, too much action, one dimensional characters and, most importantly, not much fun to watch. It's not among the worst Indian films (despite being on the IMDB Bottom 100)....but it's pretty difficult to enjoy...even as a bad film.

Dabangg 3 review :

Salman Khan is back to wish us Merry Christmas. Usually reserving an Eid release for his films, he decides to give his fans an early Eidi this time. Enjoying superstar status like no other today, Khan ticks off all the boxes in the checklist of what his fans typically desire from him.

A hero wali entry- tick Slow motion action - double tick Cheesy one liners - tick tick tick One item gaana - tick Shirtless scene - tick tick. (Even his pants drop in this one). A formidable villain - tick

In short, Dabangg 3 has everything crammed in its two hour fifty minutes run time just to please the lowest common denominator which comprises Salman's loyal fan club.

What the film doesn't have is a story, sense and sensibility. Now now, dont take me to be an elite prude or a Bhai hater! I aint. Infact, I personally liked his Dabangg 1 (2010) and few recent blockbusters like Bajrangi Bhaijaan (2015) and Sultan (2016). I genuinely tried hard to enjoy Dabangg 3 as well but failed.

The first half is pathetic where nothing - absolutely nothing - happens. The family shamily drama is a yawn and Chulbul Pandey's (Salman obviously) backstory with his young sweetheart Khushi (Saiee Manjrekar) is unexciting, to put it mildly. That debutant Saiee looks like Salman's beti in the romantic scenes makes matter worse. ..

Next, the main villain Bali Singh (Kichcha Sudeepa) enters the frame, falls for Chulbul's girl and begins his full on rivalry with Pandeyji.

On the films only positive, Kannada Superstar Kichcha Sudeepa plays a truly effective antagonist and actually steals the thunder from Salman bhai in most of the scenes he appears in. Brilliant!

Saiee Manjrekar looks pretty but gets too small a role to prove her acting chops. Sonakshi Sinha, reprising her role of Rajjo, is strictly okay. Pramod Khanna fills in for his late brother Vinod Khanna's Prajapati Pandey role. One misses the original Munni Malaika Arora's sexy thumkas in the 'Munna Badnaam hua' item number.

On the tech front, editing by Ritesh Soni is below par. Prabhu Deva's direction is even worse. More woe, the songs are not a patch on the previous two installments and they keep popping up every ten fifteen minutes to slow down the already sluggish narrative. The action finale is stretched beyond a point of endurance.

Finally, Dabangg 3 seems to be a hurriedly made and haphazardly assembled product which adds no value to the franchise.

Since a decade or two, Salman Khan has been repeating himself in film after film. Nevertheless, he has achieved remarkable success churning the same outdated content to his star struck fans. The question remains, For how long??!!!!

Regards Sumeet Nadkarni

review_title: "A weak story paired with an overdose of action!"
review_detailed_main:
The Dabangg movie series has almost established itself as a cult cinema series and it always reminds us of Sallu Bhai's signature moves, whenever we think about it. The 3rd installation of the series is now finally here and this movie has been dubbed into Kannada also this time to cater to the Kannada speaking audience. This is another win for the dubbing activists as the dubbing 'ban' of other movies into Kannada cinema is steadily coming off!

The story of the film has its links to the earlier 2 parts and mainly shows Chulbul Pandey's encounter with another gangster named Balli Singh. The story also shows some events prior to that of the first film, acting as a prequel. It shows how Chulbul becomes a loveable cop A.K.A. Robinhood Pandey and how Balli Singh is connected to his past.

The script is very poorly written with a predictable and uninteresting storyline. The film feeds the viewer with a huge platter of action than what he can actually digest! There are also lot of illogical twists and turns making this one a draggy affair.

The film lacks the effective usage of dialogues and there should have been more of it to keep the viewer engaged. There are also a lot of unnecessary slow motion scenes, testing your patience and making this movie experience a tedious one to watch.

Salman Khan is at his usual best, Kicchha Sudeepa gives out a good performance. Sonakshi Sinha looks beautiful as Chulbul's dear wifey! Saiee Manjrekar gives a picture perfect act. The music is the major plus point of this film and there are some catchy foot-tapping songs which will definitely entertain you!

All in all this film has a weak storyline and an overdose of action sequences. It can however serve as a decent timepass cinema outing for the family audience!

The trailer before the release gave me hope that film would be entertaining but after actually this film a top class boring film.

Other two part of Dabangg franchise had one solid USP - Salman Khan. He was the backbone of the film and really kept me glued to the screen. But this time Salman was clueless. He overacted, had bad dialogue delivery throughout the film and the acting was horrible.

Salman always receive negativity in terms of acting but I am one of the few people who genuinely loves his acting. He is a natural entertainer but in this movie he failed totally as an actor..

You are spending so much movie on this type of heavy budgeted movie and still making dud ones?

Second half of Dabangg 3 was still somewhat watchable but the first half was really really horrible.

Saiee Manjrekar was good and sonakshi sinha was okay. Sudeep was really good in this movie. Music was a big let down.

The only saving grace for me in this film was that I watched this on Amazon Prime, not in theatre. :)
Dabangg3 is not a movie, it's a disaster. Worst music, worst direction, worst action. Neither a mass movie nor a class movie. Don't waste your money for this crap.

Watched on Amazon Prime and couldn't tolerate this for 45 mins. Can't imagine how this would have felt watching in the theater with a friend/partner. Full of outdated cliche with repeated and stale humor from its earlier releases. Producers and sponsors just milking the franchise dry. Shame to see Salman degrading into such a pathetic state. I wonder if the kids watching this movie today can ever relate to what made the original Dabangg so entertaining.

review_title: I dont know why people are crying so much
review_detailed_main:
I mean if you went to this movie you already knew what a typical Salman Khan action movie would be like, esp. Dabanng series. I infact found this to be best of this series, second being the worst.

Most people are love to hate Salman for making same movies, but still have not watched Bajrangi Bhaijaan which is one of best movies in Bollywood in the last decade. Many of the 1-star reviews sound like some drunken pretentious idiots blabbering. These same people would not trouble watching some Hollywood flick which is just as ridiculous, and almost every action movie is ridiculous in some aspect. Its not meant to be an exercise in philosophy, just good entertainment. I am we all love Dark Knight series, but just how realistic is it to have a caped crusader. Its still a great series.

Coming to the movie, the first 10-20 mins are definitely cringeworthy. Even I stopped watching in the first fight scene itself. So a lot of people might have written reviews without watching the entire movie. But the movie goes on a different level after main story starts. Sudeep esp. as a villain is pure evil. He is the best of villains so far in this series. Just has a cold psychopath demeanor which plays perfect counterfoil to the over the top hero.

The action sequences are far more tamed, and the movie has just the right dose of comedy action and drama. Some people would like to hate Salman for trying to be in every scene, but the first two scenes in which he meets the villain are almost entirely on Sudeep, Salman being the secondary actor there.

I however skipped the songs, and there seemed to be too many of them.

Salman as usual is the superstar, he is funny and serious in just what the scene demands. Granted he does not have the best diction in a few scenes, but he isn't gunning for Oscar either.

If you want to watch some deep intellectual stuff, I dont even know what you are doing here. For those who want to watch a good action comedy, please just forward through the first 10-15 mins and then enjoy.

review_detailed_main:
Salman is excellent again as Chulbul, with some wonderful nods to previous films. Sudeep is by far the best villain in the series, and Sonakshi's character is far deeper also.

A wonderful, hilarious, and well rounded film for all the family.

7 Years after Dabangg 2 we get the third installment of an amazing film series. One of the things that I loved about this film is that it stays true to its predecessors. Anyone who liked Dabangg or Dabangg 2 will love this one.

9/10

Like the last two films this one starts with Pandey Ji stopping a crime in progress. Some goons have robbed a wedding and are now in their hideout counting the money. Enters Inspector Chulbul Pandey. This time he comes from underground. This is an action-comedy film and first half an hour is filled with both action and comedy. The film shifts its tone once Pandey ji finds out that the boss of the human trafficking gang he caught (Sudeep) is someone he had a run in with in the past. There we get a flash back of Pandey ji's younger days before he became a cop.

This is a treat for Dabangg film fans because a lot of care has been given to the scenes of the flashback. We get to see how innocent Pandey ji becomes badass Robinhood Pandey. How he picks up his style also the legendary dialogues of Chedi Singh and "Swagat nahi karoge hamara!" As a young Pandey, Salman Khan portrays an innocent persona that is akin to his character in Bodyguard.

The making is good. Prabhu Deva did an excellent job of maintaining the original feel of Dabangg and Dabangg 2 while elevating the look and feel. The locations are amazing. Costume is great. The music and dance is colorful, full of energy and fitting. Salman Khan showed superb energy on the dance floor. There is no complaint on the acting department, everyone did their part well. Salman khan as young Pandey did an excellent job. The new girl Saiee Manjrekar played her role well. Would have loved to see more of Sonakshi Sinha.

The best of part of Dabangg series is it's "hatke" dialogue and Dabangg 3 has it in truckload. From retelling the old ones to delivering new ones Dabangg 3 packs quite a few memorable dialogue. Another thing that is better than Dabangg and Dabangg 2 is the entry of Salman Khan is more effective in Dabangg 3. Almost all of his entry was mass.

The music is catchy. Action is well made, the earlier action scenes had dose of comedy and gradually the fights got serious till the explosive climax fight. I loved the climax action scenes. It had some really cool scenes. It was also bloody like Dabangg (2010). Dabangg 3 improves on the last two of the series and provides an entertaining action-comedy ride. Must watch for who liked Dabangg and Dabangg 2.

Dabangg 3 - is an all out Salman Khan Action Packed Masala movie. After the disappointment from Race 3/Bharat - Salman has come back, in his most suited Avatar. Dabangg 3 is far better then the previous two movies and the major reason is Sudeep and director Prabhudeva. First half is a little slow but gripping in terms of Mass, as it's all about Chulbul's previous life as you can see in the trailer. First half this movie has comedy/innocent love/emotion/family sentiments/heart breaking tears and a lot more. Second half is really fast and you would not want to blink your eyes as you might miss something, it's full of action and has the present Chulbul - who is grown up with his very deep voice does absolute justice. I think this movie will 100% become Salman's 4th 300cr movie or short of 250cr at least because movie offers everything that a Masala movie has. It also offers a social message which is quiet admiring as it's a masala movie and you don't get to see these kind of messages in Masala movies often. SALLU fans are in for a treat with early Christmas gift and general audience I'd say go watch it as you will not be disappointed and will come out happier.

For the past few years we have been watching Salman Khan doing experimental roles. However, he is back to entertain the mass. Dabangg 3 brings us the Salman Khan which everyone wants to see. Salman Khan as Chulbul Pandey is mind blowing. He takes the entire film on his shoulders. Kichha Sudeepa as Balli Singh is extraordinary. It seems that he was born to play the character. Sonakshi Sinha as Rajjo Pandey is good. She made her presence well despite having limited scope. Saiee Manjrekar as Khusi is very pretty. She makes her debut well. Apart from them all the other actors have given a good performance. The movie carries various social messages based on dowry, water scarcity and women safety.

We LOVED it! Action, romance, great story line, Salman Khan! If you are a fan of the Dabangg franchise, you will absolutely love this film, as it carefully explains why Chulbul Pandey is the way he is. Direction was the best of the three Dabangg films so far - full credit to the director Prabhudeva. If you haven't seen Dabangg 3 yet, go and check it out!

review_title: 100 times better than the trailer of the film!
review_detailed_main:
Dabangg 3 touched the zenith of the franchise !! With no doubt, it's a perfect Salman Khan film we were thirsty for. Salman's performance in Action, Acting, Comedy, Romance & even in writing the film is above anyone's expectation. Direction of the film 10 on 10! Narration 10 on 10 Music & background score is 10 on 10 Songs are not all good, but absolutely the album is a rest from the remakes!!!

Best parts- (for which you should see the film) 1. All the action scenes, specially the greatest climax. 2. Before interval time. 3. Munna badnaam song. 4. Bali singh's attitude. 5. Dialogues. 6. Mention if i missed anything!
It's a outstanding action Salman Khan in his own genre.

review_title: Chulbul Pandey vs Balli Singh Show

review_title: Beware of the Negative Reviews, they are just paid bots.
review_detailed_main: Like really, the people who are complaining about depth in the script & novelty should go through a psychiatric checkup. If you want such things, you should have watched Super 30 or Chhichhore. If you have watched the previous parts, you just know what to expect. This movie was explained as a masala movie.. So obviously the story will be from the 90s. The thing which did Matter was the screenplay & the music both of which was good enough. The movie successfully delivers what it promises. A Holiday Entertainer.. With emotions, comedy, action & good music. And as usual the quirky Chulbul Pandey who gets an origin story in this one, plays to the gallery... A Christmas massy blockbuster..!!!
